column4: when i type in emerald --replace it changes to desired window theme, but i can not keep it after restart. any sugestion?
Make emerald boot on startup in System -> Preferences -> Settings
well there is no settings under preferenses, do you mean settings inside emerald program?
no, no, System -> Preferences - > Session
add "emerald --replace" to that
can not find session under preferences either
hmm, they may have removed that in recent builds. And I can't even check now, because I'm on Windows. :(
heh ok:)

after installing os x theme, i think it became a emerald theme by default. because when i restart it has the maximize minimize and close at the left side. any idea how i did that ? cause i can not remember how i did it:)
that's how the theme works, I guess.
yeah but i have complete changed it out, there was a different theme, different icons and a diferente emerald theme. so is it ubuntu default to have it on the left side. i dont think it is?
hmm ok. thanks for the help anyway:)
np, sorry I couldn't be more helpful.
if i write metacity --replace, remove the emerald --replace from the startup. will i be booted with a default ?
should do.
alright, but what excactly do metacity --replace do?
it launched metacity (the standard window manager), replacing whatever is already running.
nice, thanks for calrification
no problem :)
did not work. the close minimize maximise is still on left side. hmmm. could it be anything else i need to do?
I'm afraid I have no idea.
ok:)
